I believe they should keep Ascension. Mostly because it isn't really a new game mode but a new game type. One for all, Hexa-kill, U.R.F., etc... were just spinning rims, bells, and whistles on existing game types. Ascension ,on the other hand, is something completely new with its own set of game mechanics. The only thing ascension shares with dominion is the map.

If the whole Shurima event is coming to an end after tomorrow, we had better get a proper resolution the various loose ends of this event. Like for example:
+Ezreal
+Amumu
+Zilean
+Skarner
All of these champions had their prior, much more detailed lore "replaced" with basic summaries, and have yet to actually have a ROLE in this event or any actual display for their new lore ala Azir, Sivir, and Cassiopeia.
To add on top of that, we have yet to hear the story from any side except Nasus/Azir. We've been TOLD that Xerath's much more malicious actions and such are only from Azir's point of view and that he's supposedly still very true to the more outright neutral, ambition/knowledge-fueled arcane force people love. Yet currently that's nothing more than an informed attribute, and Xerath is so far a despot and traitor who cared nothing for the fact that he is apparently responsible for Shurima's destruction. And as for Renekton, we STILL don't know exactly how he went mad. What happened in that tomb for a virtuous defender of Shurima to become a mad butcher who believed his brother betrayed him?
I sincerely hope that this event isn't going to end with numerous plotholes and unanswered questions, otherwise this does nothing to help your case in saying that the lore needs to be retconned and the Institute/Summoners removed in order to tell a better story.
